intervention_catalogue.name: Stepwise Relationship
intervention_catalogue.short_description: Stepwise Relationships aims to support desistance from Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) offending by enabling participants to overcome challenges such as: relationship problems; social skills deficits; attitudes that support relationship violence; aggression and anger; and, emotional mismanagement / self-regulation
intervention_catalogue.long_description: Stepwise Relationships has the following features: 1. A self-monitoring/behavioural analysis mechanism; 2. insight-oriented psycho-educational content on thinking (e.g., biases), emotions (e.g., jealousy), behaviour (e.g., understanding abusive behaviour); 3. skills building around thinking (e.g., seeing the bigger picture), emotions (e.g., mindfulness, relaxation, time out, etc), behaviour (e.g., negotiation, being assertive, etc); 4. building social capital.
intervention_catalogue.session_detail:
1 x One-to-one session
9 x group sessions

possible_outcomes: Enables participants to overcome challenges such as: relationship problems; social skills deficits; attitudes that support relationship violence; aggression and anger; and, emotional mismanagement / self-regulation

risk_consideration.cn_score_guide:
At least one of three OASys criteria to be satisfied:
- Score of 2 on item 11.3 aggressive behaviour
- “Yes” answer to thinking & behaviour being related to risk
of serious harm to self or others
- “Yes” answer to attitudes being related to risk of serious
harm to self or others
risk_consideration.ogrs_score_guide: If OVP not available, 25+ on OGRS3

special_educational_needs.exclusion_literacy_level_guide: Participants should be sufficiently literate (able to read and understand simple sentences)

exclusion.remaining_license_community_order_guide: Check with Treatment Manager if less than 9 months
exclusion.alcohol_drug_problem_guide: Alcohol / drug problems need to be stable before attendance.
exclusion.mental_health_problem_guide: Those with mental health problems should only be excluded from the programme if the issues are acute and damage the individual’s ability to relate to others or concentrate
